notesStmt.note: Folio 1r contains a list of works which had belonged to an early owner, this manuscript being included. Mosheh ben Mordekhai ha-Rofe᾿ de Palazzo: inscribed with his name, folio 1r. Eliyah Camerini: inscribed, folio 1r. Camillo Jaghel: inscribed with his name, 1619 (folio 409v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 36 quires: i-ii12; iii14; iv12; v-x10; xi-xii12; xiii-xvii10; xviii-xxxv12; xxxvi9.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of approximately 1060-1170 (late 11th up to mid 12th century).

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Marble edges. Spine title: 'Midrash Bereshith Rabba and Vai-Yikra Rabba. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27 169.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 279; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153).
